solution.text:
Since the distance of the race is a constant = _{{400*j}}_ m
Therefore, we know the number of participants taking part and distance each participant runs are inversely proportional
Number of participants x distance each runs = total distance of race
_{{4*k}}_ \(\times\) Distance run by each participant = _{{400*j}}_
Distance run by each participant = \( \frac{_{{400*j}}_}{_{{4*k}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Distance run by each participant = _{{100*(trunc(Decimal(j)/Decimal(k), 2))}}_ m

content.text: A _{{400*j}}_ metre relay race, has 4 participants in each team. Due to bad organisation, _{k}_ times the participants come from each school and the rules are changed such that now each team has _{{4*k}}_ participants. How much distance does each participant run?
